question_text:
Question 20
In the context of cross-drainage structures, the correct statement regarding the relative position of a natural 
drain (stream/river) and an irrigation canal is/are
(A) In a canal syphon, natural drain water goes through the irrigation canal
(B) In an aqueduct, natural drain water goes under the irrigation canal, whereas in a super-passage, natural 
drain water goes over the irrigation canal.
(C) In an aqueduct, natural drain water goes over the irrigation canal, whereas in a super-passage, natural 
drain water goes water the irrigation canal.
(D) In a level crossing natural drain water goes through the irrigation canal.
